abstract.text: Searches the children of the receiving node to perform processing for nodes that share a name.

A block to execute on nodes that match the
parameter. The block has the signature
This method enumerates the child array in order, searching for nodes whose names match the search parameter. The block is called once for each node that matches the name parameter.
The following Swift code shows how you could enumerate through the child nodes of a scene with a name containing the string
. Each matching node is hidden until the enumeration finds a node that also contains the string
. When this node is reached,
is set to
and the processing stops.

abstract.text: A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
Add high-performance 2D content with smooth animations to your app, or create a game with a high-level set of 2D game-based tools.
The base class of all SpriteKit nodes.
Searches the children of the receiving node for a node with a specific name.
Searches the children of the receiving node to perform processing for nodes that share a name.
Returns an array of nodes that match the name parameter.
Access nodes by name to avoid needing an instance variable.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
